block.p: READING REPORTS -- Signals on inflation will come from reports on the Consumer Price Index (Friday), the Producer Price Index (Thursday) and the Fed's beige book on regional economic conditions (Wednesday).

Other reports this week include May retail sales, May import prices and April business inventories (Wednesday); the first-quarter current-account deficit, industrial production and capacity utilization and the Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index (Friday).

CORPORATE EARNINGS -- Wall Street banks will begin reporting their second-quarter results, with Lehman Brothers (Tuesday) and Goldman Sachs and Bear Stearns (Thursday). Other earnings reports will come from Take-Two Interactive Software (Monday) and Freddie Mac (Thursday).

PLAVIX INQUIRY -- Bristol-Myers Squibb is scheduled to plead guilty on Monday to charges that it lied to the government about its proposed settlement of a patent dispute related to the heart drug Plavix.

SHAREHOLDER MEETINGS -- Annual meetings will be held by Yahoo (Tuesday) and the mortgage lender Countrywide Financial (Wednesday). The Midwest Air Group's annual meeting Thursday could turn into a battle. A rival, AirTran Holdings, has nominated three people to the board as part of its effort to acquire the company.
MEETING ON RATES -- The Bank of Japan will make a decision on interest rates (Friday).
